title: President Trump Spends Christmas at Mar-a-Lago, and Joe Biden in Delaware
sub_head: Mr. Trump thanks front-line medical workers, law enforcement, first responders in statement
body:
WASHINGTON—President Trump is spending Christmas at his private Florida club and President-elect Joe Biden will remain in Delaware, the unofficial headquarters of his transition to the White House.
In a statement released by the White House on Friday, Mr. Trump thanked front-line medical workers, law enforcement and first responders.
“Your daily contributions are an example of the selfless love of God and remind us of the noble principles we strive to live by, especially during this special time of year,” he said.
Later, the president said on Twitter he would give brief remarks to U.S. service members across the world via videoconference, with “Fake News not invited!”
Mr. Trump arrived at Mar-a-Lago on Wednesday night after vetoing a $740.5 billion defense-policy bill and demanding that lawmakers revise a coronavirus-aid package that funds the federal government. The president issued a string of pardons, including of his former campaign chairman Paul Manafort, longtime adviser Roger Stone, and Charles Kushner, his son-in-law’s father. He is expected to remain at Mar-a-Lago until the New Year.
